intro: Osmorhiza divaricata var. nuda, commonly known as the slender cow-wheat, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and stream banks. Its leaves are lanceolate and have a distinctive, slightly hairy surface. The flowers are small and white, arranged in clusters, and the plant produces a single, elongated fruit that splits into two parts upon maturity.
